svg.font-family: SauceCodePro Nerd Font, Source Code Pro, Courier

g.text: A template for quickly building login systems on top of Node.js; a fork of
for the allowable options of the verbs.
Millisecond duration for attempting to send emails. Defaults to 5000.
Email site URL. Base URL added within password reset and activation emails.
Locale for server log messages; defaults to "en-US".
Whether to disable logging; defaults to `false` (logging is enabled).
Database user; only needed with env=production
Database password; only needed with env=production
Current working directory; used with `--config`; defaults to `process.cwd()`
Not normally needed; used to point to instrumented path. Defaults to
Points to a base path for finding locales. Defaults to `app/server`. Only
Points to a path or URL to which to redirect after users successfully log in.
Defaults to `/home` (or locale equivalent). Note that if you are overriding
this option, you should provide another means to your users to visit `/home`,
e.g., through the accessibility-recommended approach of having a site-wide
navigation bar, so as to allow your users to update or delete their accounts.
Note that this option will be overridden by any `redirect` query parameter
A convenience to allow overriding the default route name per locale, e.g.,
for the `en-US` locale. If present, this will take precedence over the
Users who are granted all available privileges to view and edit users.
Whether to allow cross-domain redirects (for some values set by
`customRoute`). Note that the very old Firefox 2 will not be able to make
cross-domain redirects regardless of this setting, so it will always use the
Path to a Node file that will be imported. The file must have an ESM default
function export that accepts the template options (_, jml, baseurl, name,
user, passKey, fromText, fromURL). Defaults to
Path to a Node file that will be imported. The file must have an ESM default
function export that accepts the template options (_, jml, baseurl, name,
user, activationCode, fromText, fromURL). Defaults to
Whether to require a name (separate from user name, as in a real name) from
Point to absolute path at which to serve static files on the same server.
Multiple allowed. Not required. To require serving within a particular non-
root path, use `router` with Express' `app.get()` or `app.post`. See
Path to a Node file that will be imported. The file must have an ESM default
function export that will be passed the resolved options. Multiple allowed.
Not required. To require serving within a particular non-root path, use
Path to a Node file that will be imported. The file must have an ESM default
function export that will be passed the Express `app` instance and resolved
Path to a Node file that will be imported. Use for a file server. The file
must have an ESM default function export that will be passed the `req`
object, `res` object, and `next` function. Probably required.
Mainly for easier debugging. Whether to use browser ESM source modules where
available in place of compiled IIFE code. Defaults to `false`.
Whether to drop the core-js polyfills for compatibility with older browsers.
Path to a Node file that will be imported. The file must have an ESM default
function export that will be passed a config object, including a `template`
string indicating the template being built. Must return an object with any of
which should either be an HTML string or an array of Jamilih children to be
appended at the given position (or return an empty array to add nothing). Not
Used to set config; when `cwd` is set, defaults to "<cwd>/nogin.json"; of
lower priority than other CLI arguments; may also be a JavaScript file
Two-letter country codes as JSON array; defaults to codes in
The database adapter to use. Defaults to "mongodb", the only current option.
The path to a favicon; defaults to blank.
The path to a custom CSS stylesheet; defaults to no extra stylesheets being
Whether to suppress addition of built-in stylesheets, Bootstrap, and gh-fork-
ribbon.css. Defaults to `false`, i.e., built-in stylesheets are applied.
Regular client-side JavaScript file to load after other scripts (none by
ESM client-side JavaScript file to load after other scripts (none by default)
Whether to load framework scripts locally instead of via CDN. Defaults to
Person's name to include as from text in email notifications (password
URL of person to include as link on from text in email notifications
Whether to host coverage within `/coverage`; defaults to `false`.
Whether to show the `/users` page. Off by default for privacy. (May be
removed as an option in the future if privileges are added.)
Used for mitigating DoS attacks; defaults to 100
Disable Cross-site Resource Forgery checking. This setting should normally
Disable helmet use entirely. Off by default.
Options to be supplied to helmet. Defaults to `\u007bframeguard:
Options to be supplied to csurf. Defaults to `\u007bcookie: \u007bsigned:
true, sameSite: "lax"\u007d`; you may wish to add `secure: true` to the
Options to be supplied to `cookie` of `express-session`.Defaults to
Options to be supplied to `express-session`.Defaults to \u007bresave: true,
